Question: Navigation Instruction given at initial position: [rise up and go straight down the bridge and stop halfway. turn to the right and go over water look left and go under bridge. turn right and go forward back the street stopping at intersection and looking right. rise up and go right stopping at the red and white bottle cap. go straight until reaching brown and then look down and right at the water.]. At the initial position, you are asked to move according to a series of movement instructions. What are you doing now?  
choose:  
A. I turn right and walk forward back to the street, stopping at the intersection and looking to the right.  
B. I cross the water.  
C. I stand up and walk to the right, stopping at the red and white bottle caps.  
D. I turn right at the building.  
E. I go to the road.

textgrad_result.init_answer: Option: A; Reason: The sequence of images shows the agent initially moving straight down the bridge, stopping halfway, turning right, and going over water. After looking left and going under the bridge, the agent turns right again and proceeds forward back to the street. The current action aligns with stopping at the intersection and looking to the right, as indicated by the navigation instruction. This matches option A, which describes turning right and walking forward back to the street, stopping at the intersection and looking to the right.
